text: Bristol Temple Meads railway station is a main line train station in Bristol, England. The station has main trains to Paddington, Retrieved 5 July 2012 Cardiff Central Retrieved 5 July 2012 and the South Coast of England. Retrieved 5 July 2012 There are also trains towards Taunton. Retrieved 5 July 2012 South Western Railway have services to London Waterloo. Retrieved 5 July 2012 There are trains to Plymouth and Penzance, Retrieved 5 July 2012 and to Birmingham, Manchester and Scotland. Retrieved 5 July 2012 it has thirteen platforms ==Future== In November 2012, Network Rail announced a Â£100 million redevelopment of the station, with two unused platforms to be opened up. ==References== Category:Railway stations in England Category:Buildings and structures in Bristol
title: Bristol Temple Meads railway station
